behaviorVariationId.Wiki: variationId of behaviorParam to use for attacks.

sortId.Wiki: ID used to sort this weapon in the menus

weaponWeightRate.Wiki:
Affects animation recovery timing (such as dodging or follow-up attacks) via TAE event 300.
Higher values mean slower recovery, lower values mean faster recovery.
Values determine how much of the early recovery event (if present) is not active, from 0%% to 100%%.
Effects of values will be dependent on the length of the early recovery event.
1 = 100%% (slowest), .5 = 50%% (half), 0 = 0%% (fastest)

fixPrice.Wiki: Soul cost of repairing 100%% of the weapon. Repair cost is calculated using this and durabilityMax

basicPrice.Wiki: Soul cost of reinforcement. See ShopLineupParam for shop prices

sellValue.Wiki: Souls received when feeding this weapon to Frampt (unverified)

spEffectBehaviorId0.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to victims of attacks from this weapon

spEffectBehaviorId1.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to victims of attacks from this weapon

spEffectBehaviorId2.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to victims of attacks from this weapon

residentSpEffectId.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to the wielder of this weapon

residentSpEffectId1.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to the wielder of this weapon

residentSpEffectId2.Wiki: ID of spEffectParam to apply to the wielder of this weapon

materialSetId.Wiki: ID of EquipMtrlSetParam to use during reinforcement, which determines reinforcement materials and amounts.

originEquipWep.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +0 (details needed)

originEquipWep1.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +1 (details needed)

originEquipWep2.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +2 (details needed)

originEquipWep3.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +3 (details needed)

originEquipWep4.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +4 (details needed)

originEquipWep5.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +5 (details needed)

originEquipWep6.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +6 (details needed)

originEquipWep7.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +7 (details needed)

originEquipWep8.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +8 (details needed)

originEquipWep9.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +9 (details needed)

originEquipWep10.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +10 (details needed)

originEquipWep11.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +11 (details needed)

originEquipWep12.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +12 (details needed)

originEquipWep13.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +13 (details needed)

originEquipWep14.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +14 (details needed)

originEquipWep15.Wiki: ID of the weapon this weapon ascends from and reverts into at +15 (details needed)

antiDemonDamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier against enemies with isDemon (demons) in npcParam. Used by Black Knight weapons in vanilla.\n1.1 = +10%% damage

antSaintDamageRate.Wiki: Divine AUX damage and damage multiplier against enemies with isWeakSaint in npcParam. Also prevents immortal skeletons from resurrecting.\n1.1 = +10%% damage

antWeakA_DamageRate.Wiki: Occult AUX damage and damage multiplier against enemies with isWeakA in npcParam.\n1.1 = +10%% damage

antWeakB_DamageRate.Wiki: Damage multiplier against enemies with isWeakB (darkwraiths) in npcParam. Used by Greatsword of Artorias (divine) in vanilla.\n1.1 = +10%% damage

vagrantItemLotId.Wiki: Possibly ID of ItemLotParam to use for the vagrant system? (needs testing)

vagrantBonusEneDropItemLotId.Wiki: Possibly ID of ItemLotParam to use for the vagrant system? (needs testing)

vagrantItemEneDropItemLotId.Wiki: Possibly ID of ItemLotParam to use for the vagrant system? (needs testing)

saDurability.Wiki: Never used. Possibly capable of adding poise while attacking? (needs testing)

guardAngle.Wiki: Never used. Possibly modifies blocking angles? (needs testing)

reinforceTypeId.Wiki: ID of ReinforceParamWeapon to use for calculating the effects of reinforcement.

weaponCategory.Wiki: Partially unknown. Determines the ammo type ranged weapons use. Values (sometimes) correlate with weapon types, but wepmotionCategory seems to be used for a lot of systems instead.

wepmotionCategory.Wiki: ID of player TAE to use as the base animation moveset. Also checked by chrESD using GetEquipWeaponCategory for various reasons. See spAtkcategory for moveset overwrites.

correctType.Wiki: ID of CalcCorrectGraph to use for calculating how stats affect scaling.

spAtkcategory.Wiki: ID of player TAE to use as the overwriting animation moveset, such as special attacks, but also for entire weapon sub-types like Scythes and Curved Greatswords.\nSee wepmotionCategory for base movesets.

guardBaseRepel.Wiki: Base deflection defense value used when blocking. If a blocked attack has a deflection attack value less than the deflection defense value, the attack will bounce

attackBaseRepel.Wiki: Base deflection attack value used when attacking. If the victim has a deflection defense value greater than the deflection attack value, the attack will bounce

isEnhance.Wiki: Determines if weapon can be enhanced, such as with magic weapon spells.

isLuckCorrect.Wiki: Determines if weapon damage scales with humanity.

baseChangeCategory.Wiki: Definitely determines something for reinforcement/infusion (but I dont remember! Infusion menu? Needs testing.)

Self.Wiki:
Defines weapon types and each affinity.
Includes arrows and bolts. Responsible for scaling shown on certain consumables.
IDs not ending in a multiple of 100 are ignored.
Permitting affinities on a weapon without affinity rows at the correct IDs will result in the nearest 10000 being used.
SpEffects specified here can be modified by upgrades in ReinforceParamWeapon.
